results.title: Compression
results.brief_description: Ricky Morris is the 21st member of his family to see active service for Australia. He is proud to be part of the fighting Gunditjmarra people. His story looks at the invisible pressures modern soldiers constantly face and his realisation that this was shared by his family waiting for him at home.

results.title: Artists of Eldorado
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet local artists Maureen Hearn, Denise Ellison, Thea Day, Sandra Buchan and Sam Anderson, and learn about their inspirations and artistic practice. Moved by the magic of Eldorado, in northern Victoria, these artists are never short of inspiration. Day, Ellison and Buchan make time each week to get together and share their passion for painting and line drawing. Hearn works out of her studio that showcases her love of the river and obsession with chickens. Anderson is a metal sculptor who works on his family farm creating large scale works, such as his ‘Gorilla’, which must be seen to be believed.

results.title: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White
results.brief_description: An emotional account by WWII veteran, Ivor White, about his involvement in the war in New Guinea and the tragic circumstances that brought about the death, on 14 July 1944, of his mate Jack Reynolds.

results.title: Paddle Steamer Curlip
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Roberto Salvatore, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Join a group of passionate volunteers as they describe the trials, tribulations and joys of building and running a paddle steamer. From the initial planning in 2002, a group of Orbost locals built the PS Curlip II as part of a community project. After 16,000 hours of voluntary labour the paddle steamer was launched and continues in 2013 to transport tourists in and around the various waterways of East Gippsland. Members of the PS Curlip Committee talk about the history, their involvement and the future of the much-loved paddle steamer.

results.title: Why we luv Jammo
results.creator_credit: Matt Blackwood, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: A diverse cross-section of the “Jammo” community tell us why they’ve chosen this particular slice of heaven to call home. The post-mistress, the erstwhile town photographer, the caravan park operator and a handful of other locals, explain how they came to live in Jamieson (located in north-eastern Victoria) and how the peace, quiet and stunning natural beauty have convinced them there is really no better place to live. The rustling of the wind in the trees, native bird calls and tinkling waterways contribute a natural soundtrack which helps evoke this unique place.

results.title: Following their footsteps
results.brief_description: The small towns of Kernot and Grantville in south-eastern Victoria, depend on volunteer emergency services to ensure that when fires break out, car accidents happen or cats are stuck in trees, that someone is there to help. Who better to have on call than local legend Barrie Stewart and the dedicated members of the Kernot/Grantville CFA.

results.title: Nanneella Primary School
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This small rural Primary School of 26 students is at the heart of Nanneella and its residents. With a motto of ‘A School and Community Together’ the Primary School is an integral part of all town events and social gatherings. The students are engaging and fun young individuals with clear ideas and hopes for the future. This film also features a performance from ‘Power Wars’, a musical piece that incorporates science and drama and won Nanneella Primary School the 2009 Archimedes Award.

results.title: My Colbo
results.brief_description: This film takes us on a tour of Colbinabbin and surrounds from the point of view of a number of locals. From the Old Cellar and Community Well to Chinaman’s Bend and Marian’s old family home that is covered in writings from the past, this story is full of historical facts and current realities. It also includes the story of the short-lived but successful Colbinabbin Tractor Pull and the once vibrant Lake Cooper which is now dry and has been for some years.

results.title: Life in the waves: a story about Island Surfboards
results.brief_description:
Sandy Ryan’s life revolves around surfing, helping his dad run ‘Island Surfboards’ on Phillip Island in south-eastern Victoria, and teaching others how to ride waves. Matt’s best mate and mentor, Glyndyn, is an ex-pro surfer that shapes boards for ‘Island Surfboards’ and doesn’t mind a surf either.
This is a story about a mateship, keeping it local and living the surfing lifestyle dream.

results.title: Ladies of Lockington
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the ladies who are at the heart of Lockington. These passionate and committed women get things done. They network, coordinate, manage and harness the talent that is available to them to improve and enhance the quality of life for all the families of Lockington and surrounding districts.
